news.title: IPRED: A Hushed Up Directive
news.body: The EU parliament in Strasbourg is about to debate the "Intellectual Property Rights Enforcement Directive" (IPRED), which further restricts European law on copyright, patents and other unspecified "intellectual property rights." The directive's rapporteur is French MEP Janelly Fourtou, wife of the head of Vivendi Universal, a group of media and telecommunications companies.
